intro: Pedicularis rhaetica var. letourneuxii, commonly known as the Rhaetian lousewort, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, are adapted for pollination by specific insect species. The variety letourneuxii is distinguished by its unique floral morphology and habitat preferences compared to other varieties of Pedicularis.
